com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCExtentionBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBehavior
      • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCExtentionBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IYRCApiCallbackhandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    YRCWizardExtensionBehavior

    public abstract class YRCExtentionBehavior
extends YRCBaseBehavior
    Extension behavior class providing framework for accessing and performing various tasks using extensibility.
    Author:
    statikonda

      • init

        public void init()
        This method is called when the form is inirialized. It can be overriden to perform various initializaions and/or loading default data.

      • preCommand

        public boolean preCommand(YRCApiContext apiContext)
        The method is called before starting an API. The user should override the method for validations and/or capturing additional data. In case of failure the method returns false and the API call is aborted.
        Note: The method should be used strictly for validation purposes and capturing extra data only. One should not remove any of the elements or attributes in the input/ouptut xml.
        Parameters:
        apiContext -
        Returns:
        boolean: a false value aborts the API call.

      • postCommand

        public void postCommand(YRCApiContext apiContext)
        The method is called after and api call has been completed.
        Note: The method should be used strictly for validation purposes and capturing extra data only. One should not remove any of the elements or attributes in the input/ouptut xml.
        Parameters:
        apiContext -

      • getFieldValue

        public final java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Specified by:
        getFieldValue in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the control for which the value needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the string value of the control. In case of combo and list boxes, it will be the value corresponding to the code value. If the code value is null, the description value is returned.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.getFieldValue(String)

      • setFieldValue

        public final void setFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior
        Sets the value of the control on the screen. The set value, if applicable, will be displayed on the screen.
        Specified by:
        setFieldValue in class YRCBaseBehavior
        obj - The value that needs to be set on the control. For most of the controls it is a text value. Only in case of radio/check box ,if 'obj' is an instance of Boolean then selection is set according to the boolean value of 'obj'.Otherwise, 'obj' is used to set display text.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.setFieldValue(String, Object)

      • processSelectedRow

        public void processSelectedRow(java.lang.String tableName,
                               org.w3c.dom.Element selectedElementFromTable)
        Method called when a table row is selected. Subclasses should override the method if some validation needs to be performed on row selection.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The control name of the table whose row is selected.
        selectedElementFromTable - The element corresponding to selected row in the table.

      • validateTextField

        public YRCValidationResponse validateTextField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                               java.lang.String fieldValue)
        Method called to validate a text entered in an extended text control. Over-ridden implementation of this method is expected to return an instance of YRCValidationResponse with a proper code and message.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The control name of the text box.
        fieldValue - The value entered in the text box.
        Returns:
        an instance of YRCValidationResponse with a proper code and message.
        See Also:
        YRCValidationResponse

      • validateButtonClick

        public YRCValidationResponse validateButtonClick(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Method called when an extended button is clicked. Over-ridden implementation of this method is expected to return an instance of YRCValidationResponse with the proper code and message.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The control name of the clicked button.
        Returns:
        An instance of YRCValidationResponse with the proper code and message.
        See Also:
        YRCValidationResponse

      • validateLinkClick

        public YRCValidationResponse validateLinkClick(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Method called when an extended link is clicked. Validations can be performed on the values entered. Over-ridden implementation of this method is expected to return an instance of YRCValidationResponse with a proper code and message.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The control name of the clicked button.
        Returns:
        An instance of YRCValidationResponse with a proper code and message.
        See Also:
        YRCValidationResponse

        Returns:

      • showError

        public final void showError()
        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior
        Message dialog showing the errors in the screen. This will show only one control in error at a time and the focus will go to the control in error. For table if full row selection is provided then the row in error will be highlighted .
        Specified by:
        showError in class YRCBaseBehavior
        See Also:
        YRCScreenHandler.showError()

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The boolean value if the screen is in error.
        See Also:

        Note:The namespace name should be a valid namespace defined in the commands file.
        Overrides:
        getTargetModel in class YRCBaseBehavior

        namespace - The namespace name of the model.
        Returns:

      • getTargetModel

        protected org.w3c.dom.Element getTargetModel(java.lang.String namespace,
                                             boolean ignoreEmptyAttributes)
        Note:The namespace name should be a valid namespace defined in the commands file.
        Overrides:
        getTargetModel in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace name of the model.
        ignoreEmptyAttributes - boolean value specify if the model should contain empty attributes or not. Pass true if the model shouldnot contain empty attributes and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Returns the model populated from the target bindings specified on the screen.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.getTargetModel(String, boolean)

      • getInputObject

        public java.lang.Object getInputObject()
        Utility method to get the input object which is passed when the behavior is created.
        Returns:

      • getTableColumnBinding

        public YRCTblClmBindingData getTableColumnBinding(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                  java.lang.String columnName)
        Utility method which gets invoked during behavior construction, to get the table column binding object for all Advanced columns added through extensibility.
        Note:
        • This method is invoked during behavior initialization, hence other behavior methods may not be accessible/functional during this call.
        • If null is returned as the table column binding object, then the extended table column will not be created.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The table name for which the column has been added.
        columnName - The column for which binding data is required.
        Returns:
        The table column binding object.
        See Also:
        YRCTblClmBindingData.isExtendedColumn(), YRCFieldExtension.isAdvanced()

      • getExtendedTableBindingData

        public YRCExtendedTableBindingData getExtendedTableBindingData(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                               java.util.ArrayList tableColumnNames)
        This method is called to get the binding definition of the extended table. The binding data extends the binding data for the existing table column. The extended data definition provides support for providing links, images, colors and editable cells in for the table columns added through extensibility.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table being extended.
        tableColumnNames - A list of name of table colunms added through extensibility.
        NOTE: The list of table column names includes the name of advanced table columns only. For a standard table column, the binding data is created from the metadata definition as defined using the extensibility tool. For advanced table columns one has to create and return the binding data.
        Returns:
        The table binding data for the extended table.
        See Also:
        YRCExtendedTableBindingData

      • getBindingData

        public java.lang.Object getBindingData(java.lang.String fieldName)

        public void postSetModel(java.lang.String namespace)
        This method is called when a model is set in the form.
        Parameters:

      • addEventHandler

        public final void addEventHandler(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  int eventType)
        Adds an event handler to the control for the given event type. The control must not be null.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field for which a handler has to be associated with.
        eventType - The event type for event handling.
        See Also:
        SWT.DefaultSelection, SWT.Selection, handleEvent(String, YRCEvent)

      • setColumnVisible

        public final void setColumnVisible(java.lang.String tableName,
                                   java.lang.String columnName,
                                   boolean visible)
        The method needs to be called when a tablecolumn has to be hidden programmatically . The variable "visible" in the method signature is 'false' when the column has to be hidden,otherwise 'true'.
        Parameters:

        columnName -
        visible -

      • setControlData

        public void setControlData(java.lang.String fieldName,
                           java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        This method is to set data on controls (OOB or custom).
        Parameters:
        fieldName - is the name of the control on which data needs to be set
        key - is the key for the data
        value - is the value set for the key
